branches.name: feature/weighted-edits
branches.rationale: To enhance similarity scoring by allowing certain character substitutions to count differently in edit distance calculations.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_weights method
commits.body: Added a new method to calculate edit distance with weighted character substitutions.

commits.title: Update API for weighted edits
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to expose the new distance_with_weights method.

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_weights
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include the new method and its usage.

commits.title: Add tests for distance_with_weights
commits.body: Created unit tests to validate the functionality of distance_with_weights.

branches.name: feature/max-distance-cutoff
branches.rationale: To improve performance by allowing the distance method to return early for inputs exceeding a specified threshold.

src/Levenshtein/levenshtein_cpp.pyx: Add new methods distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) and similarity(s1, s2, max_dist=N)
docs/levenshtein.rst: Update documentation for new max distance methods
tests/test_levenshtein_distance.py: Add tests for max distance methods

risk_notes: Ensure backward compatibility with existing methods.

commits.title: Implement max distance methods
commits.body: Added distance and similarity methods with max distance parameter.
per_file_changes: Added distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) and similarity(s1, s2, max_dist=N)

commits.title: Update documentation for max distance methods
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include the new max distance methods.
per_file_changes: Added documentation for distance and similarity with max distance

commits.title: Add tests for max distance methods
commits.body: Created unit tests to validate the functionality of the new max distance methods.
per_file_changes: Added test cases for distance and similarity with max distance

branches.name: feature/multi-threaded-batch
branches.rationale: To allow faster processing of large lists of strings for similarity ranking through parallel computation.

src/Levenshtein/levenshtein_cpp.pyx: Add new batch method batch_distance(list1, list2, threads=T)

commits.title: Implement batch_distance method
commits.body: Added a new method to compute distances in batches using multiple threads.

commits.title: Update documentation for batch_distance
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include the new batch_distance method.

commits.title: Add tests for batch_distance method
commits.body: Created unit tests to validate the functionality of batch_distance.

branches.name: feature/edit-operations-path
branches.rationale: To provide detailed insights into the edit operations performed during distance calculations.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_ops method
commits.body: Added a new method to output the edit operations path.

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_ops
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include the new distance_with_ops method.

commits.title: Add tests for distance_with_ops method
commits.body: Created unit tests to validate the functionality of distance_with_ops.

branches.name: feature/unicode-grapheme-clusters
branches.rationale: To ensure multi-codepoint characters are treated as single units in distance calculations, improving correctness.

commits.title: Implement grapheme support
commits.body: Added an optional parameter to support grapheme clusters.

commits.title: Update documentation for grapheme support
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include the new grapheme support.

commits.title: Add tests for grapheme support
commits.body: Created unit tests to validate the functionality of grapheme support.
per_file_changes: Added test cases for grapheme support

branches.name: feature/pure-python-fallback
branches.rationale: To maintain functionality on platforms where the C extension cannot compile, enhancing portability.

src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Update API to select fallback module

commits.title: Add pure-Python fallback module
commits.body: Created a fallback module to ensure functionality on non-C compatible platforms.

commits.title: Update API for fallback selection
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include logic for selecting the fallback module.

commits.title: Update documentation for fallback module
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include the new fallback module.
